Description¶

A base level metadata system providing the framework for higher level interfaces.

Interfaces¶

There are two base level dependency node interfaces provided by this module:

  • Meta: Associates low level operations with an encapsulated dependency node. Implements a registration system for persistent identification of metadata.
  • MetaDag: Associates low level operations with an encapsulated DAG node. Inherits from Meta.

There are three base level dependency node plug interfaces provided by this module:

  • MetaAttribute: Associates low level operations with an encapsulated dependency node plug. Designed to interface with the above dependency node encapsulations.
  • MetaArrayAttribute: Associates low level operations with an encapsulated dependency node array plug. Inherits from MetaAttribute.
  • MetaCompoundAttribute: Associates low level operations with an encapsulated dependency node non-array compound plug. Inherits from MetaAttribute.

Terminology¶

The following terminology is adopted by this module and other modules within this package.

Term Description
nodeId The UUID that is assigned to a dependency node upon creation.
mNode An instantiated (non-strict) subclass of Meta. Provides a metadata encapsulation of a dependency node.
mType A (non-strict) subclass of Meta.
mTypeId The name of a (non-strict) subclass of Meta. Used with an mSystemId to register an mNode or identify the mType of a tagged dependency node.
mSystem A system of related mTypes that can be used to build a network or hierarchy of tagged dependency nodes. Provides the ability to register metadata within a persistent framework that associates a programatic interface with a contractual system of dependency nodes.
mSystemId The name of an mSystem, assigned to each mType via its SYSTEM_ID attribute. Used with an mTypeId to register an mNode or identify the mType of a tagged dependency node.
mSystemRoot A property assigned to each mType via its SYSTEM_ROOT attribute. Defines whether an mType is the root of an mSystem, used for identifying tagged dependency nodes.
mAttr An instantiated (non-strict) subclass of MetaAttribute. Provides an encapsulation of a dependency node plug which has been designed to interface with mNodes.

Registration¶

The Meta registration system allows for the persistent association of an mType with a dependency node, enabling mNode retrieval for tagged dependency nodes.

Systems¶

Higher level mSystems such as msTools.metadata.systems.mrs should be used to build a network or hierarchy of tagged dependency nodes. This should provide the ability to register metadata within a persistent framework that associates a programatic interface with a contractual system of dependency nodes. The contracts which were used to create the system of dependency nodes should allow the mSystem to generalize accross different setups. For example a modular rigging system should define certain contracts which would allow an mSystem to register metadata for different setups.
exception msTools.metadata.systems.base.MSystemError¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Raised for operations which involve an invalid or incompatible mSystem.

exception msTools.metadata.systems.base.MTypeError¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Raised for operations which involve an invalid or incompatible mType.

class msTools.metadata.systems.base.Meta(node=None, name=None, nType='network', register=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Bases: msTools.core.py.metaclasses.AbstractAccessWrapper

A dependency node encapsulation designed to provide base level metadata functionality to higher level mSystem abstractions.

Interface:

The encapsulation associates a low level interface with the node, similiar to that of an OpenMaya function set. The interface is designed to operate directly on OpenMaya inputs as to maintain coherent type dependence.

Typically higher level mSystems may define specific relationships between their mTypes. These relationships can be registered within the dependency graph for type specific identification of metadata.

Registration:

A persistent tagging system enables an mType to be associated with a dependency node:

  • When an mNode is registered, its mType and mSystem are used to tag the encapsulated dependency node with mTypeId and mSystemId attributes. The mNode is added to an internal registry for optimised retrieval within the current session. If the user attempts to instantiate the same mType with the same dependency node, the registered mNode will be returned.
  • When an mNode is deregistered, its mType is disassociated from its encapsulated dependency node by removing the mTypeId and mSystemId attributes. The mNode is removed from the internal registry.

An mNode can only be registered if isRegisterable returns True.

Attributes:

The ability to modify the namespace of an mNode is restricted in order to preserve the following behaviours:

  • When retrieving attributes, the encapsulated dependency node will only be queried if there is no class/instance attribute.
  • When setting attributes, the encapsulated dependency node will be accessed if the attribute is not registered as exclusive to the mNode.

Validation:

The interface provides the option to track the state of the encapsulated dependency node. When tracking is enabled, an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError will be raised when attempting to access the interface of an invalid encapsulation. The isValid property and __repr__() method will remain accessible regardless of whether the functional state is invalid.

Subclassing:

Derived mTypes should be implemented as part of a system.

The following attributes can be overridden to define the mSystem properties of an mType:

  • SYSTEM_ID: Define the mSystem of an mType.
  • SYSTEM_ROOT: Define whether the mType is an mSystemRoot.

The following attributes can be overridden to define which node types are compatible with the interface of an mType:

  • NODE_TYPE_CONSTANT: Define which OpenMaya.MFn node type constants are compatible with the interface.
  • NODE_TYPE_ID: Define a single node type which is compatible with the interface. If None, the NODE_TYPE_CONSTANT is used instead.

The NODE_TYPE_CONSTANT is also used to optimise the search for tagged dependency nodes. It must be implemented even if the NODE_TYPE_ID is assigned.

The EXCLUSIVE attribute must be overridden by any subclass which implements its own exclusive data. The override only needs to include the names of property setters and instance attributes which are defined within the subclass implementation.

Derived mTypes which implement their own initialiser must:

  • Invoke the baseclass initialiser.
  • Enforce an initial node argument within the signature, used to identify a dependency node via an OpenMaya.MObject wrapper. The argument must be defined positionally within the signature in order to be accessible from __new__().
ALL_EXCLUSIVE = set(['_node', '_nodeFn', '_nodeHandle', '_nodeId', '_partialName', '_stateTracking', 'notes', 'stateTracking'])¶
EXCLUSIVE = set(['_node', '_nodeFn', '_nodeHandle', '_nodeId', '_partialName', '_stateTracking', 'notes', 'stateTracking'])¶

Defines exclusive instance attributes which can be set using the default object.__setattr__() behaviour.

  • Includes the names of property setters defined by this mType.
  • Includes the names of instance attributes which are assigned to an mNode via __init__().

Invoking __setattr__() with a non-exclusive attribute will attempt to access the attribute via the encapsulated dependency node.

Access:R
Type:set [str]
NODE_TYPE_CONSTANT = 4¶

Defines which OpenMaya.MFn dependency node types are compatible with this mType.

Type compatibility is determined by calling hasFn() on an OpenMaya.MObject wrapper of the dependency node.

Access:R
Type:int
NODE_TYPE_ID = None¶

Allows subclasses to define a single dependency node type that is compatible with their mType.

Designed for node types which are not associated with a specific OpenMaya.MFn type constant such as those derived from OpenMaya.MPxNode.

Access:R
Type:OpenMaya.MTypeId | None
SYSTEM_ID = 'base'¶

Defines the mSystemId of this mType, used as a property for registering mNodes and identifying tagged dependency nodes.

Access:R
Type:basestring
SYSTEM_ROOT = False¶

Defines whether this mType is the root of an mSystem, used as a property for identifying tagged dependency nodes.

Access:R
Type:bool
absoluteNamespace¶

Absolute namespace of the encapsulated dependency node. Includes all parent namespaces and a : delineating the root.

Access:R
Type:str
baseNamespace¶

Leaf level namespace of the encapsulated dependency node. Does not include parent namespaces of the leaf. The leaf namespace of the root will be an empty string.

Access:R
Type:str
fullName¶

Full name of the encapsulated dependency node.

The full name is qualified by a path and namespace where applicable. It is guaranteed to uniquely identify the node with the maximum amount of information (full path for the first occurrence of a DAG node).

If the encapsulated dependency node is a not a DAG node, the full name is equivalent to its partial name.

Type:str
hasValidTag¶

True if the encapsulated dependency node is tagged with an mTypeId attribute that corresponds to the derived mType of this mNode, otherwise False.

Access:R
Type:bool
isLocked¶

True if the encapsulated dependency node is locked, otherwise False.

Access:R
Type:bool
isReferenced¶

True if the encapsulated dependency node is from a referenced file, otherwise False.

Access:R
Type:bool
isRegisterable¶

True if this mNode can be registered, otherwise False.

A DAG node can only be registered to an mType which is a (non-strict) subclass of MetaDag. This ensures the MetaDag interface can always produce outputs with an appropriate upper bound mType.

Access:R
Type:bool
isTagged¶

True if the encapsulated dependency node is tagged with mSystemId and mTypeId attributes, otherwise False.

Access:R
Type:bool
isValid¶

True if the internal OpenMaya.MObject wrapper references a valid dependency node, otherwise False.

Note

This property is not subject to stateTracking and is therefore accessible even if the encapsulated dependency node is deleted.

Access:R
Type:bool
node¶

Wrapper of the encapsulated dependency node.

Access:R
Type:OpenMaya.MObject
nodeFn¶

Function set encapsulation of the encapsulated dependency node.

Access:R
Type:OpenMaya.MFnDependencyNode
nodeId¶

UUID of the encapsulated dependency node.

Access:R
Type:str
notes¶

Information stored with the 'notes' attribute of the encapsulated dependency node.

Access:RW
Type:str
partialName¶

Partial name of the encapsulated dependency node.

The partial name is qualified by a path and namespace where applicable or necessary. It is guaranteed to uniquely identify the node with the minimum amount of information necessary (partial path for the first occurrence of a DAG node).

If the encapsulated dependency node is a not a DAG node, the partial name is equivalent to its full name.

Access:R
Type:str
shortName¶

Short name of the encapsulated dependency node.

The short name has no qualifying path or namespace. It is not guaranteed to uniquely identify the node.

Access:R
Type:str
stateTracking¶

Whether to track the state of the encapsulated dependency node in order to restrict access to the public interface if invalid.

Restriction involves raising an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError upon attempting to access a bound instance attribute from the public interface. The following bindings are excluded: __repr__(), isValid.

Access:RW
Type:bool
__delattr__(attr)¶

x.__delattr__(attr) <==> delattr(x, attr).

Delete an attribute directly from the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:

attr (basestring) – Name of a dynamic, non-child attribute on the encapsulated dependency node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If attr does not identify an attribute on the encapsulated dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr identifies a static attribute.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr identifies a child attribute.
  • RuntimeError – If the plug corresponding to attr is locked or has a locked and connected descendant plug.

x.__eq__(y) <==> x == y.

Parameters:other (any) – Any object.
Returns:bool – If other has an equivalent type, return whether its contents (dependency node) are equivalent. Otherwise swap the operands and return the result, unless the operands have already been swapped in which case the result is False.

__getattribute__(attr)¶

x.__getattribute__(attr) <==> getattr(x, attr).

Access the value referenced by an attribute of this instance or attempt to retrieve a plug from the encapsulated dependency node via getPlug().

Note

Instance access precedes dependency node access. Invocation via the instance access operator limits access to root level plugs, while getattr() allows for direct retrieval of descendant plugs.

Parameters:attr (basestring) – Name of an instance attribute or dependency node plug.
Raises:AttributeError – If an instance attribute or dependency node plug could not be identified for the given attr name.
Returns:any | T <= MetaAttribute – Data referenced by the instance attribute or mAttr encapsulation of a dependency node plug corresponding to attr.
__init__(node=None, name=None, nType='network', register=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Base initialiser for all mNodes.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a dependency node to encapsulate. Defaults to None - A new dependency node will be created using the nType.
  • name (basestring, optional) – Name for the new dependency node if node is None. Defaults to None - The mTypeId will be used.
  • nType (basestring, optional) – Node type identifier used to create a dependency node if node is None. If the node type derives from a shape, its transform will be encapsulated. Defaults to 'network'.
  • register (bool, optional) – Whether to register this mNode internally, tagging the encapsulated dependency node with the mTypeId and mSystemId of the derived mType. Defaults to False.
  • stateTracking (bool, optional) – Whether to track the state of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to True - Access to the interface is conditional upon this state.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If node is None and nType is an invalid node type identifier or is incompatible with the accepted node types of the derived mType.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node references a dependency node whose type is incompatible with the accepted node types of the derived mType.
  • MTypeError – If an attempt is made to register a DAG node to an mType that is not a (non-strict) subclass of MetaDag.
__ne__(other)¶

x.__ne__(y) <==> x != y.

Parameters:other (any) – Any object.
Returns:bool – The negation of __eq__().
static __new__(cls, *args, **kwargs)¶

Base constructor for any mType that is not a (non-strict) subclass of MetaDag.

If a dependency node is received, the internal registry will be checked for an mNode with the same encapsulated dependency node and derived mType. A new mNode will be constructed for the dependency node if the registry does not contain a matching mNode.

If no dependency node is given, an empty mNode will be constructed and assigned a new dependency node.

__repr__()¶

x.__repr__() <==> repr(x).

Note

This method is not subject to stateTracking and is therefore accessible even if the encapsulated dependency node is invalid. In this case cached data is used.

Returns:str – A string representation of the mNode.
__rshift__(other)¶

x.__rshift__(other) <==> x >> other <==> other.cacheNode(x.node).

Cache the encapsulated dependency node on that of another mNode via cacheNode().

Parameters:other (T <= Meta) – mNode to receive the cache.
__setattr__(attr, value)¶

x.__setattr__(attr) <==> setattr(x, attr, value).

Set the value of an exclusive instance attribute or retrieve a plug from the encapsulated dependency node and set its value via MetaAttribute.set().

Note

Instance access precedes dependency node access. Invocation via the instance access operator limits access to root level plugs, while setattr() allows for direct retrieval of descendant plugs.

Parameters:
  • attr (basestring) – Name of an exclusive instance attribute or dependency node plug.
  • value (any) – Used to set the value referenced by the instance attribute or held by a dependency node plug corresponding to attr.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If a dependency node plug could not be identified for the given attr name.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr identifies a dependency node plug array.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr identifies a dependency node compound plug with a child array or compound.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr identifies a dependency node plug that references a typed attribute which holds OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList type data and the OpenMaya.MObject value does not reference OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type data.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr identifies a dependency node plug that references an unsupported attribute type.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr identifies a dependency node plug that references a numeric or typed attribute with an unsupported data type.
  • TypeError – If attr identifies a dependency node plug for which the value type is not supported.
  • ValueError – If attr identifies a dependency node plug which requires a sequence of values with a different length to the value sequence.
  • RuntimeError – If attr identifies a dependency node plug which has an input connection.
addCompoundAttribute(childAttributes, shortName=None, longName=None, resultAsMeta=False, **kwargs)¶

Add a new dynamic compound attribute to the encapsulated dependency node, useful for storing a related set of data.

Note

Dynamic attributes should be married to a single dependency node. Callers are responsible for ensuring the childAttributes have not already been added to a dependency node. Failing to do so may produce undefined behaviour.

Parameters:
  • childAttributes (iterable [OpenMaya.MObject]) – Wrappers of attributes to add as children of the compound attribute.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return the new plug as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If both shortName and longName are None.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If any of the childAttributes do not reference an attribute.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName or the same name as any of the childAttributes.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulation of the new dependency node plug. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
addEnumAttribute(fields, shortName=None, longName=None, default=None, resultAsMeta=False, **kwargs)¶

Add a new dynamic enum attribute to the encapsulated dependency node based on a mapping of field names to integer values.

Parameters:
  • fields (dict [ basestring, int ]) – Mapping of field names to unique values.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • default (basestring, optional) – Default field, must correspond to a key in the fields mapping. If None, the field with the smallest value will be used. Defaults to None.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return the new plug as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If both shortName and longName are None.
  • ValueError – If the fields mapping is empty or the set of values contained within the fields mapping is not unique.
  • KeyError – If the default field does not exist within the fields mapping.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulation of the new dependency node plug. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
addMatrixAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, dataType=1, matrix=None, resultAsMeta=False, **kwargs)¶

Add a new dynamic matrix attribute to the encapsulated dependency node based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnMatrixAttribute.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • dataType (int, optional) – Type constant present on OpenMaya.MFnMatrixAttribute representing the default data type. Either single precision (kFloat) or double precision (kDouble). Defaults to kDouble.
  • matrix (OpenMaya.MMatrix | OpenMaya.MFloatMatrix, optional) – Default value for the attribute. If None, an identity matrix of the given dataType will be used. Defaults to None.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return the new plug as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If both shortName and longName are None.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulation of the new dependency node plug. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.

  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return the new plug as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array.

Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulation of the new dependency node plug. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.

Add a new dynamic numeric attribute to the encapsulated dependency node based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • dataType (int, optional) – Type constant present on OpenMaya.MFnNumericData representing the default data type. Valid values are kFloat, kAddr, kChar, kByte, kShort, kInt, kInt64, kDouble, kBoolean, k2Short, k2Int, k2Float, k2Double, k3Short, k3Int, k3Float, k3Double, k4Double. Multi data point types such as k2Float will create a compound attribute of type OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Float. In this case, child attribute names would be suffixed with an index and would be of type OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, storing kFloat data. Defaults to kFloat.
  • point (bool, optional) – If True, the dataType will be ignored and an attribute of type OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float will be created, storing k3Float data. If value is given, it must be a three-element tuple. Child attribute names will be suffixed with 'X', 'Y', 'Z' respectively and will be of type OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, storing kFloat data. Defaults to False.
  • color (bool, optional) – If True and point is False, the dataType will be ignored and an attribute of type OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float will be created, storing k3Float data. If value is given, it must be a three-element tuple. Child attribute names will be suffixed with 'R', 'G', 'B' respectively and will be of type OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, storing kFloat data. Defaults to False.
  • value (numeric-type, optional) – Default value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.
  • min_ (float | int, optional) – Min value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • max_ (float | int, optional) – Max value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • softMin (float | int, optional) – Soft min value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • softMax (float | int, optional) – Soft max value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return the new plug as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If both shortName and longName are None.
  • ValueError – If a compound attribute type is passed a value with an incompatible number of elements.
  • TypeError – If the value type is incompatible with the dataType.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulation of the new dependency node plug. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
addTypedAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, dataType=4, value=None, resultAsMeta=False, **kwargs)¶

Add a new dynamic typed attribute to the encapsulated dependency node based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnData.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • dataType (int, optional) – Type constant present on OpenMaya.MFnData representing the default data type. Supported constants are: kComponentList, kDoubleArray, kIntArray, kMatrix, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface, kPlugin, kPointArray, kString, kStringArray, kVectorArray. Defaults to kString.
  • value (any, optional) –

    Default value for the attribute. The following values are compatible with each dataType constant:

    • kComponentList: An OpenMaya.MObject referencing derived OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type data.
    • kMatrix: An OpenMaya.MMatrix or OpenMaya.MTransformationMatrix.
    • kDoubleArray, kIntArray: An iterable of numeric data.
    • kVectorArray: An iterable of OpenMaya.MVector data.
    • kPointArray: An iterable of OpenMaya.MPoint data.
    • kStringArray: An iterable of basestring or json serializable data.
    • kString: A basestring or json serializable data.
    • kPlugin: An OpenMaya.MTypeId specifying a user defined data type.
    • kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface: None.

    Defaults to None.

  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return the new plug as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If both shortName and longName are None.
  • ValueError – If the dataType is unsupported (eg. kNumeric, kFloatArray, etc).
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the dataType is kComponentList and the OpenMaya.MObject value does not reference component data.
  • TypeError – If the value type is incompatible with the dataType.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulation of the new dependency node plug. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
addUnitAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, dataType=2, value=None, min_=None, max_=None, softMin=None, softMax=None, resultAsMeta=False, **kwargs)¶

Add a new dynamic unit attribute to the encapsulated dependency node based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnUnitAttribute.

  • max_ (float | int | OpenMaya.MAngle | OpenMaya.MDistance | OpenMaya.MTime, optional) – Max value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.

  • TypeError – If the value, min, max, softMin or softMax type is incompatible with the dataType.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulation of the new dependency node plug. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
cacheComponent(sourceComponent, shortName=None, longName=None)¶

Cache shape node components on the encapsulated dependency node.

A connection will be made from the static 'message' attribute of the souce node to a typed attribute on the encapsulated dependency node. The typed attribute will hold the component data from the source node.

Parameters:
  • sourceComponent ((OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject)) –

    A two-element tuple representing component data to cache on the encapsulated dependency node.

    1. Path encapsulation of a shape node.
    2. Wrapper holding OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type date corresponding to components on the shape node.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the new typed attribute used to cache the component data. If None, the longName will be used. If the longName is also None, the short name of the node referenced by sourceComponent will be suffixed by '__components'. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the new typed attribute used to cache the component data. If None, the shortName will be used. If the shortName is also None, the short name of the node referenced by sourceComponent will be suffixed by '__components'. Defaults to None.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the first element of sourceComponent does not reference a shape node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the second element of sourceComponent does not reference component data.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
cacheNode(sourceNode, shortName=None, longName=None)¶

Cache a dependency node on the encapsulated dependency node.

A connection will be made from the static 'message' attribute of the souce node to a message type attribute on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • sourceNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node to cache on the encapsulated dependency node.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourceNode. If None, the longName will be used. If the longName is also None, the sourceNode short name will be used. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourceNode. If None, the shortName will be used. If the shortName is also None, the sourceNode short name will be used. Defaults to None.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If sourceNode does not reference a dependency node.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
cachePlug(sourcePlug, shortName=None, longName=None)¶

Cache a dependency node plug on the encapsulated dependency node.

A connection will be made from the source plug to a message type attribute on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • sourcePlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug to cache on the encapsulated dependency node.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) – Short name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourcePlug. If None, the longName will be used. If the longName is also None, msTools.core.maya.name_utils.getPlugStorableName() will be used to determine a name for the sourcePlug. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) – Long name for the new message type attribute used to cache the sourcePlug. If None, the shortName will be used. If the shortName is also None, msTools.core.maya.name_utils.getPlugStorableName() will be used to determine a name for the sourcePlug. Defaults to None.
Raises:

RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node already has an attribute with the same shortName or longName.
delete()¶

Delete the encapsulated dependency node. If the node is a DAG node this will include all of its children.

Note

The current mNode will become invalid.

deregister()¶

Deregister this mNode internally and from the scene.

The encapsulated dependency node will be unlocked and its mTypeId and mSystemId tag will be removed.

Raises:
  • KeyError – If this mNode is not registered to its last valid nodeId.
  • MTypeError – If the mType of this mNode does not match the mType of the registered mNode.
deselect()¶

Remove the encapsulated dependency node from the active selection list.

disconnectDependencies(upstream=False, downstream=False, walk=False, filterTypes=None, forceLocked=False)¶

Disconnect pairs of source and destination plugs for the dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • upstream (bool, optional) – Whether to disconnect upstream dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to False.
  • downstream (bool, optional) – Whether to disconnect downstream dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to False.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force disconnect a dependency that is connected via a locked destination plug. Defaults to False.
Raises:

RuntimeError – If any of the dependencies are connected via a locked destination plug and forceLocked is False.

Example

# Remove direct connections to any constraints downstream of the encapsulated dependency node
disconnectDependencies(downstream=True, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint,))

Return a dependency node plug identified on the encapsulated dependency node by name.

component ((OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject)) –

A two-element tuple representing component data to check on the encapsulated dependency node.

iterDependenciesByEdge(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node as edges represented by a pair of connected source and destination plugs.

Each pair will correspond to a connection from a source plug to a destination plug regardless of the directionType.

Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node will be traversed.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter plug dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each pair of connected plug dependencies as mAttrs resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - yield as pairs of OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Yields:

(OpenMaya.MPlug, OpenMaya.MPlug) | (T <= MetaAttribute, T <= MetaAttribute) – A two-element tuple of connected plug dependencies.

  1. A source plug connection for a dependency of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.
  2. A corresponding destination plug connection for a dependency of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.

Together each pair represents a connected edge in the graph.
iterDependenciesByNode(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield the node dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node.

Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node will be traversed. A node is yielded if it has not been visited.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter node dependencies based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each node dependency as an mNode resulting from getMNode(). Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MObject wrappers.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If asMeta is True and a node dependency is tagged with an mSystemId that does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If asMeta is True and a node dependency is tagged with an mTypeId that does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject | T <= Meta – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations for node dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Type is determined by asMeta.
iterDependenciesByPlug(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield the plug dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node.

If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream, dependencies will correspond to destination plug connections. If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream, dependencies will correspond to source plug connections.

Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node will be traversed. A plug is yielded if it has not been visited.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node acts as the root of a path. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter plug dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each plug dependency as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulations for plug dependencies of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.
iterMetaDependenciesByEdge(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=False, nTypes=None, mTypes=None, mTypeBases=None, mSystemIds=None, mSystemRoots=False, asMeta=False)¶

Yield pairs of connected source and destination plugs which form a dependency between a tagged node and the encapsulated dependency node. Filter nodes based on the given properties.

Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node will be traversed.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Defaults to True.
  • nTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Sequence of type constants from OpenMaya.MFn used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on node type. Only consider dependency nodes if a corresponding OpenMaya.MObject is compatible with one of the given type constants. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types. Defaults to None - the node type constants used for filtering will be determined by calling getNodeTypeConstants() with mTypes.
  • mTypes (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mType. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType filtering will occur.
  • mTypeBases (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their inherited mTypes. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to an mType that inherits from one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType inheritance filtering will occur.
  • mSystemIds (iterable [basestring], optional) – Sequence of mSystem identifiers, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mSystemId. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mSystemId corresponding to one of the given identifiers. Defaults to None - no mSystemId filtering will occur.
  • mSystemRoots (bool, optional) – Whether to only consider dependency nodes which are tagged as an mSystemRoot. Defaults to False - no mSystemRoot filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each pair of connected plug dependencies as mAttrs resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - yield as pairs of OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If the mSystemId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If the mTypeId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

(OpenMaya.MPlug, OpenMaya.MPlug) | (T <= MetaAttribute, T <= MetaAttribute) – A two-element tuple of connected plugs which form a dependency between a tagged node and the encapsulated dependency node.

  1. A source plug connection for a dependency of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.
  2. A corresponding destination plug connection for a dependency of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.

Together each pair represents a connected edge in the graph.
iterMetaDependenciesByNode(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=False, nTypes=None, mTypes=None, mTypeBases=None, mSystemIds=None, mSystemRoots=False, asMeta=False)¶

Yield the tagged node dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Filter based on the given properties.

Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node will be traversed. A tagged node will be yielded if it has not been visited.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Defaults to True.
  • nTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Sequence of type constants from OpenMaya.MFn used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on node type. Only consider dependency nodes if a corresponding OpenMaya.MObject is compatible with one of the given type constants. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types. Defaults to None - the node type constants used for filtering will be determined by calling getNodeTypeConstants() with mTypes.
  • mTypes (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mType. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType filtering will occur.
  • mTypeBases (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their inherited mTypes. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to an mType that inherits from one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType inheritance filtering will occur.
  • mSystemIds (iterable [basestring], optional) – Sequence of mSystem identifiers, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mSystemId. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mSystemId corresponding to one of the given identifiers. Defaults to None - no mSystemId filtering will occur.
  • mSystemRoots (bool, optional) – Whether to only consider dependency nodes which are tagged as an mSystemRoot. Defaults to False - no mSystemRoot filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each node dependency as an mNode resulting from getMNode(). Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MObject wrappers.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If asMeta is True and the mSystemId of any tagged dependency does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If asMeta is True and the mTypeId of any tagged dependency does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject | T <= Meta – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations for tagged node dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Type is determined by asMeta.
iterMetaDependenciesByPlug(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=False, nTypes=None, mTypes=None, mTypeBases=None, mSystemIds=None, mSystemRoots=False, asMeta=False)¶

Yield plugs which form a dependency between a tagged node and the encapsulated dependency node. Filter nodes based on the given properties.

If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream, dependencies will correspond to destination plug connections. If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream, dependencies will correspond to source plug connections.

Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node will be traversed. A plug on a tagged node will be yielded if it has not been visited.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Defaults to True.
  • nTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Sequence of type constants from OpenMaya.MFn used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on node type. Only consider dependency nodes if a corresponding OpenMaya.MObject is compatible with one of the given type constants. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types. Defaults to None - the node type constants used for filtering will be determined by calling getNodeTypeConstants() with mTypes.
  • mTypes (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mType. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType filtering will occur.
  • mTypeBases (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their inherited mTypes. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to an mType that inherits from one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType inheritance filtering will occur.
  • mSystemIds (iterable [basestring], optional) – Sequence of mSystem identifiers, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mSystemId. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mSystemId corresponding to one of the given identifiers. Defaults to None - no mSystemId filtering will occur.
  • mSystemRoots (bool, optional) – Whether to only consider dependency nodes which are tagged as an mSystemRoot. Defaults to False - no mSystemRoot filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each plug dependency as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If the mSystemId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If the mTypeId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulations for plugs which form a dependency between a tagged node and the encapsulated dependency node. Type is determined by asMeta.
iterMetaNetworkByEdge(directionType=0, stepOver=True, nTypes=None, mTypes=None, mTypeBases=None, mSystemIds=None, mSystemRoots=False, asMeta=False)¶

Yield pairs of source and destination plugs which form connections between contiguous tagged dependency nodes within the meta network of the encapsulated dependency node. Filter based on the given properties.

Each connected plug on the encapsulated dependency node will be traversed. All adjacent dependency paths are traversed for each connected node.

Note

Traversal is pruned when:

  1. The source side of a connection is not a message type attribute.
  2. A connected node is not tagged with an mTypeId.
  3. stepOver is False and a connected node does not meet the given filter requirements of nTypes, mTypes, mTypeBases, mSystemIds, mSystemRoots.
Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal through the meta network of the encapsulated dependency node. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream traversal of the encapsulated dependency node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • stepOver (bool, optional) – Whether to continue traversing connections if a node does not meet the given filter requirements of nTypes, mTypes, mTypeBases, mSystemIds, mSystemRoots. Defaults to True.
  • nTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Sequence of type constants from OpenMaya.MFn used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on node type. Only consider dependency nodes if a corresponding OpenMaya.MObject is compatible with one of the given type constants. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types. Defaults to None - the node type constants used for filtering will be determined by calling getNodeTypeConstants() with mTypes.
  • mTypes (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mType. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType filtering will occur.
  • mTypeBases (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their inherited mTypes. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to an mType that inherits from one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType inheritance filtering will occur.
  • mSystemIds (iterable [basestring], optional) – Sequence of mSystem identifiers, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mSystemId. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mSystemId corresponding to one of the given identifiers. Defaults to None - no mSystemId filtering will occur.
  • mSystemRoots (bool, optional) – Whether to only consider dependency nodes which are tagged as an mSystemRoot. Defaults to False - no mSystemRoot filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each pair of connected plugs as mAttrs resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - yield as pairs of OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If the mSystemId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If the mTypeId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

(OpenMaya.MPlug, OpenMaya.MPlug) | (T <= MetaAttribute, T <= MetaAttribute) – A two-element tuple of plugs representing a connection between contiguous tagged dependency nodes within the meta network of the encapsulated dependency node.

  1. A source plug for a connection between contiguous tagged dependency nodes. Type is determined by asMeta.
  2. A corresponding destination plug for a connection between contiguous tagged dependency nodes. Type is determined by asMeta.

Together each pair represents a connected edge in the graph.

lock()¶

Lock the encapsulated dependency node.

Returns:bool – True if the lock state of the encapsulated dependency node has changed, otherwise False.
register()¶

Register this mNode internally and within the scene.

The encapsulated dependency node will be locked and tagged with an mTypeId and mSystemId for the derived mType.

The mTypeId and mSystemId tag of the encapsulated dependency node will be overridden if it was previously registered to a different mType. If an mNode corresponding to the previous mType is registered internally, it will be replaced with this mNode.

Note

This mNode can only be registered if isRegisterable returns True.

Raises:MTypeError – If an attempt is made to register a DAG node to an mType that is not a (non-strict) subclass of MetaDag.

uncacheComponent(sourceComponent, forceLocked=False)¶

Uncache shape node components from the encapsulated dependency node.

Any typed attribute on the encapsulated dependency node which holds the source component data and is connected from the static 'message' attribute of the souce node will be removed if permitted. Otherwise if the destination plug is a descendant, it will be disconnected but not removed.

Parameters:
  • sourceComponent ((OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject)) –

    A two-element tuple representing component data to uncache from the encapsulated dependency node.

    1. Path encapsulation of a shape node.
    2. Wrapper holding OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type date corresponding to components on the shape node.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force remove an attribute if the corresponding plug is locked. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the first element of sourceComponent does not reference a shape node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the second element of sourceComponent does not reference component data.
  • RuntimeError – If any of the connected typed attributes on the encapsulated dependency node correspond to a locked plug and forceLocked is False.

class msTools.metadata.systems.base.MetaArrayAttribute(plug, stateTracking=True)¶

Bases: msTools.metadata.systems.base.MetaAttribute

A dependency node array plug encapsulation designed to interface with mNodes.

The encapsulation associates a low level interface with the plug, similiar to that of an OpenMaya function set. The interface is designed to operate directly on OpenMaya inputs as to maintain coherent type dependence.

Instantiation occurs implicitly upon accessing an array attribute from an mNode via Meta.__getattribute__().

Validation:

The interface provides the option to track the functional state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug. When tracking is enabled, an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError will be raised when attempting to access the interface of an invalid encapsulation. The isValid property and __repr__() method will remain accessible regardless of whether the functional state is invalid.
ALL_EXCLUSIVE = set(['_attr', '_attrFn', '_node', '_nodeFn', '_nodeHandle', '_partialName', '_plug', '_plugId', '_stateTracking', 'stateTracking'])¶

class msTools.metadata.systems.base.MetaAttribute(plug, stateTracking=True)¶

Bases: msTools.core.py.metaclasses.AbstractAccessWrapper

A dependency node plug encapsulation designed to interface with mNodes.

The encapsulation associates a low level interface with the plug, similiar to that of an OpenMaya function set. The interface is designed to operate directly on OpenMaya inputs as to maintain coherent type dependence.

Instantiation occurs implicitly upon accessing an attribute from an mNode via Meta.__getattribute__().

Validation:

The interface provides the option to track the functional state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug. When tracking is enabled, an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError will be raised when attempting to access the interface of an invalid encapsulation. The isValid property and __repr__() method will remain accessible regardless of whether the functional state is invalid.
ALL_EXCLUSIVE = set(['_attr', '_attrFn', '_node', '_nodeFn', '_nodeHandle', '_partialName', '_plug', '_plugId', '_stateTracking', 'stateTracking'])¶
EXCLUSIVE = set(['_attr', '_attrFn', '_node', '_nodeFn', '_nodeHandle', '_partialName', '_plug', '_plugId', '_stateTracking', 'stateTracking'])¶

Defines exclusive instance attributes which can be set using the default object.__setattr__() behaviour.

  • Includes the names of property setters defined by this class.
  • Includes the names of instance attributes which are assigned to an mAttr via __init__().

fullName¶

Full name of the encapsulated dependency node plug with format '<node>.<plug>'.

  • <node> will be a partial node name qualified by a path and namespace where applicable or necessary. It is guaranteed to uniquely identify the plug’s node with the maximum amount of information necessary (full path for the first occurrence of a DAG node).
  • <plug> is guaranteed to uniquely identify the plug with the maximum amount of information necessary (full attribute path, long attribute names).
Access:R
Type:str
fullNameWithoutNode¶

The full name of the encapsulated dependency node plug, not including its node.

It is guaranteed to uniquely identify the plug relative to its node with the maximum amount of information necessary (full attribute path, long attribute names).

Access:R
Type:str
isInternallyLocked¶

True if the encapsulated dependency node plug is internally locked, otherwise False.

Note

The internal lock state of a plug is not influenced by the lock state of ancestors. A plug can be globally locked whilst also being internally unlocked.

Access:R
Type:bool
isLocked¶

True if the encapsulated dependency node plug is globally locked, otherwise False.

Note

The global lock state of a plug is influenced by the lock state of each ancestor. A plug can be globally locked whilst also being internally unlocked.

This method is designed as an alternative to OpenMaya.MPlug.isLocked which is not always reliable. Locking an ancestor plug will not have an immediate affect on the lock state of any descendant element plug which is not yet considered in-use.

Access:R
Type:bool
isValid¶

True if the internal OpenMaya.MPlug references a valid dependency node plug, otherwise False.

Note

This method is not subject to stateTracking and is therefore accessible even if the encapsulated dependency node plug is removed.

stateTracking¶

Whether to track the state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug in order to restrict access to the public interface if invalid.

Restriction involves raising an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError upon attempting to access a bound instance attribute from the public interface. The following bindings are excluded: __repr__(), isValid.

Access:RW
Type:bool

Connect a plug to the destination side of the encapsulated dependency node plug.

get()¶

Get the value held by the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Supported attribute types are: OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute4Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTimeAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute. Type OpenMaya.MFn.kCompoundAttribute is also supported if each child attribute corresponds to one of the afformentioned types.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kBoolean, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kChar, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kByte, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kShort, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kLong, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kAddr, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt64, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kFloat, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kDouble.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnData.kInvalid, OpenMaya.MFnData.kMatrix, OpenMaya.MFnData.kNumeric, OpenMaya.MFnData.kString, OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kDoubleArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kIntArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kPointArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kVectorArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList.

Note

If the encapsulated dependency node plug references a typed attribute with OpenMaya.MFnData.kString or OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray data type, an attempt will be made to json deserialize the data held by the plug.

Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug is an array.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug is a compound with a child array or compound.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug references an unsupported attribute type.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug references a numeric or typed attribute with an unsupported data type.
Returns:

any – Data held by the encapsulated dependency node plug.

iterDependenciesByEdge(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node plug as edges represented by a pair of connected source and destination plugs.

Each pair will correspond to a connection from a source plug to a destination plug regardless of the directionType.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node plug. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node plug. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter plug dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each pair of connected plug dependencies as mAttrs resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - yield as pairs of OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Yields:

(OpenMaya.MPlug, OpenMaya.MPlug) | (T <= MetaAttribute, T <= MetaAttribute) – A two-element tuple of connected plug dependencies.

  1. A source plug connection for a dependency of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.
  2. A corresponding destination plug connection for a dependency of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.

Together each pair represents a connected edge in the graph.
iterDependenciesByNode(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield the node dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node plug. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node plug. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.

iterDependenciesByPlug(directionType=0, traversalType=0, walk=True, pruneMessage=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield the plug dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node plug.

If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream, dependencies will correspond to destination plug connections. If the directionType is OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream, dependencies will correspond to source plug connections.

Note

Cyclic dependency paths may terminate back on the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Parameters:
  • directionType (int, optional) – The direction of traversal for dependencies of the encapsulated dependency node plug. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kUpstream. Values correspond to either downstream or upstream dependency traversal of the encapsulated dependency node plug. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDownstream.
  • traversalType (int, optional) – The type of dependency traversal. Valid values are either OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst or OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kBreadthFirst, exhaust an entire level of dependencies before proceeding to the next level using breadth first traversal. If OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst, exhaust an entire dependency path before proceeding to the next path using depth first traversal. Defaults to OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.kDepthFirst.
  • walk (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse entire dependency paths. If False, only direct dependencies are traversed. Defaults to True.
  • pruneMessage (bool, optional) – Whether to prune traversal when a connection originates from a message type attribute. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter plug dependencies based on their OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each plug dependency as an mAttr resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug | T <= MetaAttribute – Encapsulations for plug dependencies of the encapsulated node. Type is determined by asMeta.
