set(value, forceLocked=False)¶

Set the value held by the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Supported attribute types are: OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute4Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTimeAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute. Type OpenMaya.MFn.kCompoundAttribute is also supported if each child attribute corresponds to one of the afformentioned types.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kBoolean, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kChar, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kByte, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kShort, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kLong, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kAddr, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt64, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kFloat, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kDouble.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnData.kInvalid, OpenMaya.MFnData.kMatrix, OpenMaya.MFnData.kString, OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kDoubleArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kIntArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kPointArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kVectorArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList.

Note

If the encapsulated dependency node plug references a typed attribute with OpenMaya.MFnData.kString or OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray data type, an attempt will be made to json serialize the value if it does not reference str castable data.

Parameters:
  • value (any) – Data used to update the value held by the encapsulated dependency node plug. The type must be compatible with the data type of the attribute referenced by the plug.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force set the value if the encapsulated dependency node plug is locked. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug is an array.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug is a compound with a child array or compound.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug references a typed attribute which holds OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList type data and the OpenMaya.MObject value does not reference OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type data.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug references an unsupported attribute type.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug references a numeric or typed attribute with an unsupported data type.
  • TypeError – If the value type is not supported by the encapsulated dependency node plug.
  • ValueError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug requires a sequence of values which has a different length to the value sequence.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug has an input connection.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated dependency node plug is locked and forceLocked is False.
setProperties(**kwargs)¶

Set properties corresponding to any writable property on OpenMaya.MPlug for the encapsulated dependency node plug. Changes are placed on the undo queue.

Note

Plugs cannot have both OpenMaya.MPlug.isKeyable and OpenMaya.MPlug.isChannelBox properties True. Setting one True will set the other False.

Parameters:**kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MPlug such as OpenMaya.MPlug.isCaching, OpenMaya.MPlug.isChannelBox, OpenMaya.MPlug.isKeyable, OpenMaya.MPlug.isLocked.

Examples

# Unlock the encapsulated `mAttr` plug and set keyable
MetaAttribute.setProperties(mAttr, isKeyable=True, isLocked=False)
unlockGlobal(resultAsMeta=False)¶

Globally unlock the encapsulated dependency node plug by ensuring any locked ancestor is also unlocked.

Note

The global lock state of a plug is influenced by the lock state of each ancestor. A plug can be globally locked whilst also being internally unlocked.

Parameters:resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return unlocked ancestor plugs as mAttrs each resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Returns:list [OpenMaya.MPlug] | list [T <= MetaAttribute] – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs that have been unlocked, ordered from the furthest ancestor of the encapsulated dependency node plug.
unlockRelatives(resultAsMeta=False)¶

Unlock all ancestors and descendants of the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Designed for use before removing an attribute. Any descendant plug which is locked and connected must be unlocked in order to remove an attribute.

Parameters:resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return unlocked relative plugs as mAttrs each resulting from getMAttr(). Defaults to False - return OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations.
Returns:list [OpenMaya.MPlug] | list [T <= MetaAttribute] – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs that have been unlocked, ordered from furthest ancestor to furthest descendant of the encapsulated dependency node plug.

class msTools.metadata.systems.base.MetaCompoundAttribute(plug, stateTracking=True)¶

Bases: msTools.metadata.systems.base.MetaAttribute

A dependency node non-array compound plug encapsulation designed to interface with mNodes.

The encapsulation associates a low level interface with the plug, similiar to that of an OpenMaya function set. The interface is designed to operate directly on OpenMaya inputs as to maintain coherent type dependence.

Instantiation occurs implicitly upon accessing a compound type attribute from an mNode via Meta.__getattribute__().

Validation:

The interface provides the option to track the functional state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug. When tracking is enabled, an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError will be raised when attempting to access the interface of an invalid encapsulation. The isValid property and __repr__() method will remain accessible regardless of whether the functional state is invalid.

class msTools.metadata.systems.base.MetaDag(node=None, name=None, nType='transform', register=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Bases: msTools.metadata.systems.base.Meta

A DAG node encapsulation designed to provide base level metadata functionality to higher level mSystem abstractions.

Interface:

The encapsulation associates a low level interface with the node, similiar to that of an OpenMaya function set. The interface is designed to operate directly on OpenMaya inputs as to maintain coherent type dependence.

The encapsulation stores a path to the node for operations which require a distinct ancestral description.

Typically higher level mSystems may define specific relationships between their mTypes. These relationships can be registered within the dependency graph for type specific identification of metadata.

Inherited:

See Meta for information relating to registration, attributes, validation and subclassing.

The following amendments are made to the subclassing contract:

  • Subclass initialisers may also accept an OpenMaya.MDagPath instance for the node argument.
  • The NODE_TYPE_CONSTANT and NODE_TYPE_ID must be assigned DAG node types.
ALL_EXCLUSIVE = set(['_node', '_nodeFn', '_nodeHandle', '_nodeId', '_partialName', '_stateTracking', 'instanceNumber', 'notes', 'stateTracking'])¶
EXCLUSIVE = set(['instanceNumber'])¶

Defines exclusive instance attributes which can be set using the default object.__setattr__() behaviour.

  • Includes the names of property setters defined by this mType.

Invoking Meta.__setattr__() with a non-exclusive attribute will attempt to access the attribute via the encapsulated dependency node.

__init__(node=None, name=None, nType='transform', register=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Initialiser for MetaDag mNodes.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject | OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Wrapper or path of a DAG node to encapsulate. Defaults to None - A new DAG node will be created using the nType.
  • name (basestring, optional) – Name for the new DAG node if node is None. Defaults to None - The mTypeId will be used.
  • nType (basestring, optional) – Node type identifier used to create a DAG node if node is None. If the node type derives from a shape, its transform will be encapsulated. Defaults to 'transform'.
  • register (bool, optional) – Whether to register this mNode internally, tagging the encapsulated DAG node with the mTypeId and mSystemId of the derived mType. Defaults to False.
  • stateTracking (bool, optional) – Whether to track the state of the encapsulated DAG node. Defaults to True - Access to the interface is conditional upon this state.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If node is None and nType is an invalid node type identifier or is incompatible with the accepted node types of the derived mType.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node is an OpenMaya.MObject that does not reference a DAG node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node references a DAG node whose type is incompatible with the accepted node types of the derived mType.
static __new__(cls, *args, **kwargs)¶

Base constructor for any mType that is a (non-strict) subclass of MetaDag.

If a DAG node is received, the internal registry will be checked for an mNode with the same encapsulated DAG node, instance number and derived mType. A new mNode will be constructed for the DAG node if the registry does not contain a matching mNode.

If no DAG node is given, an empty mNode will be constructed and assigned a new DAG node.

absoluteDuplicateTo(parentPath=None, renameShapes=True, resultAsMeta=False, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate the encapsulated DAG node and parent it under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current world space transforms.

Provides a safe way to duplicate and reparent any DAG node including indirect instances and shapes.

If path is an indirect instance, a single duplicate will be created for that specific indirect instance.

Note

  • If the encapsulated DAG node is a transform, the duplicate’s local matrix will inherit the relative transform from the old parent to parentPath.
  • If the encapsulated DAG node is a shape, the duplicate will be reparented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the shape.
Parameters:
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Path to a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the duplicate. Renaming is completed via msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return duplicate nodes as mNodes each resulting from getMNode(). Defaults to False - return OpenMaya.MObject wrappers.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate().
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is a shape and parentPath is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] | list [T <= MetaDag] – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations of the duplicate nodes, including any descendants. The first element is always the root transform of the duplicate hierarchy. If upstreamNodes is True, any duplicate upstream nodes will be included. If returnRootsOnly is True, a single element list will be returned. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
absoluteReparent(parentPath=None, renameShapes=True, resultAsMeta=False)¶

Reparent the encapsulated DAG node under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current world space transforms.

Note

  • If the encapsulated DAG node is an uninstanced shape, it will be reparented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the shape.
  • If the encapsulated DAG node is an uninstanced transform, its local matrix will inherit the relative transform from the old parent to parentPath.
  • If the encapsulated DAG node is directly instanced, it will be reinstanced under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the instance.
  • If the encapsulated DAG node is indirectly instanced, other instances with the same parent will be parented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between parentPath and the instance.
Parameters:
  • parentPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath, optional) – Path to a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the new and old parents if the encapsulated DAG node is a shape. Renaming is completed via msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return paths to the reparented node as mNodes each resulting from getMNodeFromPath(). Defaults to False - return OpenMaya.MDagPath encapsulations.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parentPath is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is a shape and parentPath is None.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is already a child of parentPath.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MDagPath] | list [T <= MetaDag] – A path or mNode encapsulation to the reparented node for the first instance of each new parent. If path references an indirect instance there will be multiple paths. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
addChild(childPath, relative=False, renameShapes=True, resultAsMeta=False)¶

Reparent a DAG node under the encapsulated transform.

Parameters:
  • childPath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node to reparent.
  • relative (bool) –

    Whether to preserve the current relative transforms of the child DAG node under its new parent.

    If True:

    • If childPath is uninstanced, it will be reparented directly under the encapsulated transform.
    • If childPath is instanced, it will be reinstanced directly under the encapsulated transform.
    • If childPath is indirectly instanced, other instances with the same parent will be reinstanced under their own intermediary transform, inserted between the encapsulated transform and the instance.

    If False, absolute reparenting of childPath will be relative to the world space transforms of path:

    • If childPath is an uninstanced shape, it will be reparented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between encapsulated transform and the shape.
    • If childPath is an uninstanced transform, its local matrix will inherit the relative transform from the old parent to the encapsulated transform.
    • If childPath is directly instanced, it will be reinstanced under a new intermediary transform, inserted between encapsulated transform and the instance.
    • If childPath is indirectly instanced, other instances with the same parent will be parented under a new intermediary transform, inserted between encapsulated transform and the instance.

    Defaults to False.

  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the new and old parents if childPath is a shape. Renaming is completed via msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return paths to the reparented node as mNodes each resulting from getMNodeFromPath(). Defaults to False - return OpenMaya.MDagPath encapsulations.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is not a transform.
  • RuntimeError – If childPath is already a child of the encapsulated transform.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MDagPath] | list [T <= MetaDag] – A path or mNode encapsulation to the reparented node for the first instance of each new parent. If childPath is an indirect instance there will be multiple paths. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a transform.

Returns:bool – True if the encapsulated transform has node as one of its parents, otherwise False.
hasParentWithName(nodeShortName)¶

Return whether the encapsulated transform has a parent with a given short name.

Note

This operation queries each parent of node instead of the distinct parent referenced by path.

Parameters:nodeShortName (basestring) – Short name of a DAG node.
Returns:bool – True if the encapsulated DAG node has a parent with name nodeShortName, otherwise False.
hasShapes()¶

Return whether the encapsulated DAG node has intermediate child shapes.

Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is not a transform.
Returns:bool – True the encapsulated DAG node has child shapes, False otherwise.
inspectVisibility()¶

Inspect the visibility of the encapsulated DAG node.

The global visibility state of a node is given by OpenMaya.MDagPath.isVisible(). If any of the return values are False, the path visibility state will also be False.

Returns:(bool, bool, bool, bool) – A four-element tuple.
  1. Value of the 'visibility' attribute for the encapsulated DAG node.
  2. Value of the 'lodVisibility' attribute for the encapsulated DAG node.
  3. Visibility state of draw-overrides for the encapsulated DAG node. If False, the 'overrideEnabled' attribute is on and the 'overrideVisibility' attribute is off.
  4. Visibility state for ancestors of encapsulated DAG node. If False, the node is hidden because of an ancestor.
iterAncestors(depthLimit=-1, breadth=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield ancestors of the encapsulated DAG node.

Note

By default the world OpenMaya.MObject will be yielded since it is the root ancestor of all children. The kWorld type constant can be used to exclude this ancestor if necessary.

Parameters:
  • depthLimit (int, optional) –

    Limit the depth of iteration up ancestral branches. Defaults to -1.

    • <0 : Full traversal of ancestors.
    • =0 : No traversal.
    • >0 : Traverse until the given depth.
  • breadth (bool, optional) – Whether to use breadth first traversal. Defaults to False. If True, exhaust an entire level of ancestors before proceeding to the next level. If False, exhaust an entire branch of ancestors before proceeding to the next closest branch using depth first traversal.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter ancestors based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kConstraint. Applicable values include kTransform, kConstraint. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each ancestor as an mNode resulting from getMNode(). Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MObject wrappers.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If asMeta is True and an ancestor is tagged with an mSystemId that does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If asMeta is True and an ancestor is tagged with an mTypeId that does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject | T <= MetaDag – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations for the relative ancestor nodes. Type is determined by asMeta.

Example

# Yields ancestors relative to the encapsulated `mNode` DAG node
MetaDag.iterAncestors(mNode)
# Yields ancestors relative to the encapsulated `mNode` DAG node, excluding constraints
MetaDag.iterAncestors(mNode, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint,))
# Yields ancestor transforms relative to the encapsulated `mNode` DAG node
MetaDag.iterAncestors(mNode, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kWorld,))

Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.

  • MTypeError – If asMeta is True and a child is tagged with an mTypeId that does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject | T <= MetaDag – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations for the relative child nodes. Type is determined by asMeta.

Example

iterRelatives(shapes=False, children=False, descendants=False, parents=False, ancestors=False, filterTypes=None, asMeta=False)¶

Yield relatives of the encapsulated DAG node.

Note

By default if parents is True, the world object will be yielded if the encapsulated DAG node is parented to the world. By default if ancestors is True, the world object will be yielded since it is the root ancestor of all children. The kWorld type constant can be used to exclude this ancestor if necessary.

Parameters:
  • shapes (bool, optional) – Whether to yield child shapes. Defaults to False.
  • children (bool, optional) – Whether to yield all children. Overrides the shapes argument. Defaults to False.
  • descendants (bool, optional) – Whether to yield all descendants. Traversal will be depth first. Overrides the shapes and children arguments. Defaults to False.
  • parents (bool, optional) – Whether to yield parent transforms. If the encapsulated DAG node is instanced, the parent of each instance will be yielded. Defaults to False.
  • ancestors (bool, optional) – Whether to yield ancestor transforms. If the encapsulated DAG node is instanced, the ancestors of each instance will be yielded. Traversal will be depth first. Overrides the parents argument. Defaults to False.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Filter relative nodes based on OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh or kConstraint. Applicable values include kTransform, kShape, kCamera, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each relative as an mNode resulting from getMNode(). Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MObject wrappers.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If either shapes, children or descendants is True and the encapsulated DAG node does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If either parents or ancestors is True and the encapsulated DAG node does not reference a DAG node.
  • MSystemError – If asMeta is True and a relative is tagged with an mSystemId that does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If asMeta is True and a relative is tagged with an mTypeId that does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject | T <= MetaDag – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations for the relative nodes. Type is determined by asMeta.

Example

# Yields child transforms relative to the encapsulated `mNode` transform
MetaDag.iterRelatives(mNode, children=True, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform,))
# Yields child transforms relative to the encapsulated `mNode` transform, excluding constraints
MetaDag.iterRelatives(mNode, children=True, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kTransform, -OpenMaya.MFn.kConstraint))
# Yields ancestor transforms relative to the encapsulated `mNode` DAG node
MetaDag.iterRelatives(mNode, ancestors=True, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kWorld,))

relativeDuplicateTo(parent=None, renameShapes=True, resultAsMeta=False, **kwargs)¶

Duplicate the encapsulated DAG node and parent it under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current local space transforms.

Provides a safe way to duplicate and reparent any DAG node including indirect instances and shapes.

Parameters:
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the duplicate. If the encapsulated DAG node is a shape, renaming will occur for all shapes under parent. Renaming is completed via msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return duplicate nodes as mNodes each resulting from getMNode(). Defaults to False - return OpenMaya.MObject wrappers.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments corresponding to those from cmds.duplicate().
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is a shape and parent is None.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] | list [T <= MetaDag] – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations of the duplicate nodes, including any descendants. The first element is always the root transform of the duplicate hierarchy. If upstreamNodes is True, any duplicate upstream nodes will be included. If returnRootsOnly is True, a single element list will be returned. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.
relativeReparent(parent=None, renameShapes=True, resultAsMeta=False)¶

Reparent the encapsulated DAG node under a transform or the world whilst preserving its current local space transforms.

Note

  • If path is uninstanced, it will be reparented directly under parent.
  • If path is instanced, it will be reinstanced directly under parent.
  • If path is indirectly instanced, other instances with the same parent will be reinstanced under their own intermediary transform, inserted between parent and the instance.
Parameters:
  • parent (OpenMaya.MObject, optional) – Wrapper of a transform. Defaults to None - world is used as the parent.
  • renameShapes (bool, optional) – Whether to rename shape nodes under the new and old parents if the encapsulated DAG node is a shape. Renaming is completed via msTools.core.maya.dag_utils.renameShapes(). Defaults to True.
  • resultAsMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to return paths to the reparented node as mNodes each resulting from getMNodeFromPath(). Defaults to False - return OpenMaya.MDagPath encapsulations.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If parent is given but does not reference a transform.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is a shape and parent is None.
  • RuntimeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is already a child of parent.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MDagPath] | list [T <= MetaDag] – A path or mNode encapsulation to the reparented node for the first instance of each new parent. If path references an indirect instance there will be multiple paths. Type is determined by resultAsMeta.

# This function is equivalent to the following Maya command

removeInstances()¶

Removes all other instances of the node referenced path.

Note

Raises:RuntimeError – If the encapsulated DAG node does not reference an instanced node.
renameShapes()¶

Rename all child shape nodes under the encapsulated transform.

Names for non-instanced shapes will follow the format '<parentShortName>_shape<##>'.

Names for instanced shapes will follow the format '<parentShortName>_instance_shape<##>'.

  • '<parentShortName>' will correspond to the parent of the zeroth indexed shape instance.
  • The addition of the 'instance' token aims to prevent confusion for instances whose parent does not correspond to '<parentShortName>'.

A recursive call will be made for the parents of every instanced shape in order to avoid name clashes with their own child shapes.

Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the encapsulated DAG node is not a transform.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.cleanMNodeRegistry()¶

Remove invalid items from the internal mNode registry.

Attempts to revalidate any invalid mNode using its cached nodeId. Ensures the each registered mNode is registered under its cached nodeId. Ensures the tag of each registered mNode is valid.

msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMAttr(plug)¶

Return an mAttr encapsulation of a dependency node plug. The encapsulation is designed to provide an appropriate level of functionality for the plug.

The type of the mAttr will be determined as follows:

  • MetaArrayAttribute if plug references an array attribute of any type.
  • MetaCompoundAttribute if plug references a non-array compound type attribute.
  • MetaAttribute for any other plug.
Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Returns:T <= MetaAttribute – An mAttr encapsulation of plug for a (non-strict) subclass of MetaAttribute.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMNode(node)¶

Return an mNode encapsulation of a dependency node.

The mType of the mNode will be determined as follows:

  • If node is tagged, its mTypeId and mSystemId will be used to determine the mType.
  • If node is untagged, its node type will be used to determine a default mType that provides an appropriate level of functionality for the node. Meta provides functionality to non-DAG nodes whilst MetaDag provides functionality to DAG nodes.

Note

An mNode will be returned from the internal registry if node is tagged and registered.

Parameters:

node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If node is tagged with an mSystemId that does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If node is tagged with an mTypeId that does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Returns:

T <= Meta – An mNode encapsulation of node for a (non-strict) subclass of Meta.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMNodeFromPath(path)¶

Return an mNode encapsulation of a DAG node for a specific ancestral path.

The mType of the mNode will be determined as follows:

  • If the DAG node referenced by path is tagged, its mTypeId and mSystemId will be used to determine the mType.
  • If the DAG node referenced by path is untagged, MetaDag will be used as a default mType.

Note

An mNode will be returned from the internal registry if the DAG node referenced by path is tagged and registered.

Parameters:

path (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a DAG node.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If the DAG node referenced by path is tagged with an mSystemId that does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If the DAG node referenced by path is tagged with an mTypeId that does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Returns:

T <= MetaDag – An mNode encapsulation of path for a (non-strict) subclass of MetaDag.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMNodeFromRegistry(node)¶

Parameters:

node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.

msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMSystemRegistry()¶

Returns a registry that maps registered mTypes to their corresponding mSystemId and mTypeId. Provides centralised access to all registered Meta subclasses.

Returns:collections.namedtuple – Where each field is an mSystemId that maps to another collections.namedtuple, where each field is an mTypeId that maps to a registered mType.

Example

# Access mTypes for the all mSystems
mSystems = getMSystemRegistry()
# Access an mType via an mSystem
assert mSystems.base.Meta is Meta
# Access the mType registry for an mSystem
assert mSystems.base == getMTypeRegistry('base')
# Retrieve tagged dependency nodes for each mSystem
for mSystemId, mTypes in mSystems.__dict__.iteritems():
    assert list(iterMetaNodes(mSystemIds=(mSystemId,))) == list(iterMetaNodes(mTypes=mTypes))

msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMTypeFromNode(node)¶

  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If node is not tagged with mSystemId and mTypeId attributes.
  • MSystemError – If the mSystemId of node does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If the mTypeId of node does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Returns:

type – A (non-strict) subclass of Meta corresponding to the mType of node.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMTypeInheritance(mType)¶

Returns a collections.namedtuple object where each field maps to a registered mType that inherits from the given mType.

Parameters:mType (type) – A (non-strict) subclass of Meta.
Returns:collections.namedtuple – Where each field is an mType name that maps to a registered subclass of mType.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.getMTypeRegistry(mSystemId)¶

Returns a registry that maps registered mTypes to their corresponding mTypeId for a given mSystemId. Provides centralised access to all registered Meta subclasses for an mSystem.

Raises:MSystemError – If mSystemId does not correspond to a registered mSystem. Meaning there are no registered mTypes for that mSystemId.
Returns:collections.namedtuple – Where each field is an mTypeId that maps to a registered mType.

Example

# Access mTypes for the 'base' mSystem
mTypes = getMTypeRegistry('base')
# Access an mType from the 'base' mSystem
assert mTypes.Meta is Meta
# Retrieve tagged dependency nodes for the 'base' mSystem
assert list(iterMetaNodes(mSystemIds=('base',))) == list(iterMetaNodes(mTypes=mTypes))
msTools.metadata.systems.base.getNodeTypeConstants(mTypes=None)¶

Return the node type constants used to filter searches for tagged and registered mNodes.

Parameters:mTypes (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, from which to retrieve node type constants. Defaults to None - retrieve constants from all registered mTypes.
Returns:list [int] – Node type constants for the given mTypes or for each registered mType if mTypes is None.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.inspectMNodeRegistry()¶

Log each registered mapping of nodeId -> mNode.

msTools.metadata.systems.base.iterMetaNodes(nTypes=None, mTypes=None, mTypeBases=None, mSystemIds=None, mSystemRoots=False, asMeta=False)¶

Yield tagged dependency nodes in the scene. Filter based on the given properties.

Parameters:
  • nTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Sequence of type constants from OpenMaya.MFn used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on node type. Only consider dependency nodes if a corresponding OpenMaya.MObject is compatible with one of the given type constants. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types. Defaults to None - the node type constants used for filtering will be determined by calling getNodeTypeConstants() with mTypes.
  • mTypes (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mType. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType filtering will occur.
  • mTypeBases (iterable [type], optional) – Sequence of class types which are (non-strict) subclasses of Meta, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their inherited mTypes. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mTypeId corresponding to an mType that inherits from one of the given mTypes. Defaults to None - no mType inheritance filtering will occur.
  • mSystemIds (iterable [basestring], optional) – Sequence of mSystem identifiers, used to filter tagged dependency nodes based on their mSystemId. Only consider dependency nodes which are tagged with an mSystemId corresponding to one of the given identifiers. Defaults to None - no mSystemId filtering will occur.
  • mSystemRoots (bool, optional) – Whether to only consider dependency nodes which are tagged as an mSystemRoot. Defaults to False - no mSystemRoot filtering will occur.
  • asMeta (bool, optional) – Whether to yield each tagged dependency node as an mNode of its tagged mType. Defaults to False - yield as OpenMaya.MObject wrappers.
Raises:
  • MSystemError – If the mSystemId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mSystem.
  • MTypeError – If the mTypeId of a tagged dependency node does not correspond to a registered mType for its mSystem.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject | T <= Meta – Wrappers or mNode encapsulations for tagged dependency nodes. Type is determined by asMeta.
msTools.metadata.systems.base.resetMNodeRegistry()¶

Reset the internal mNode registry.

msTools.metadata.systems.base.unlockMeta(func)¶

Decorator used to unlock the dependency node of an mNode or mAttr.

Registered mNodes are locked to account for the following deletion issues:

  • Deleting connected network nodes will delete the entire network.
  • Calling cmds.cutKey() on a keyframed attribute of a network node will delete the node if it has no other connections.
